text:
Raskolnikov clenched his fists. 

“Hey! You Svidrigaïlov! What do you want here?” he shouted. 

The gentleman scowled. “What do you mean?” 

“Get away, that’s what I mean.” 

“How dare you, you low fellow!” He raised his cane. 

Raskolnikov turned to the girl. Her dress was torn. 

“She’s been deceived,” he said. “Look at her. She’s a child.” 

The policeman nodded, compassion in his eyes. 

“Where do you live?” he asked gently. 

The girl waved her hand, confused. 

“Here,” Raskolnikov said, pulling out twenty copecks. 

“Call a cab. Take her home.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov observes a vulnerable girl who has been deceived and is in danger, prompting him to intervene and protect her.
